intro: Inula bequaertii, commonly known as the Chinese eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to brownish flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Inula bequaertii is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
